comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 2011081200

Steps to reproduce:

* Open a page, Ctrl+S -> "Save As" dialog appears
* "Name" field contains highlighted filename.htm, "Filter" is "Web Page, complete"
* Now: change anything in the "Name" field (for instance change it to filename2.htm)


Actual results:

"Filter" field is changed automatically to "All Files". That means when the dialog
is confirmed only the main document is saved and all the contents (images, etc)
are not saved, unlike in the default case.



Expected results:

"Filter" field should not change automatically.
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 2011081200

Steps to reproduce:

* Open a page, Ctrl+S -> "Save As" dialog appears
* "Name" field contains highlighted filename.htm, "Filter" is "Web Page, complete"
* Now: change anything in the "Name" field (for instance change it to filename2.htm)


Actual results:

"Filter" field is changed automatically to "All Files". That means when the dialog
is confirmed only the main document is saved and all the contents (images, etc)
are not saved, unlike in the default case.



Expected results:

"Filter" field should not change automatically.

comments.raw_text:
Works for me (no change of "Web Page, complete") with a new, clean profile :
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110830 Firefox/9.0a1

Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

How about with a new, empty profile?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile
comments.creator: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
